page.title: 14Whiteparish School(C.E.Prim)
page.content: {ALL SAINT'S SCHOOL}- built on a site given by the Nelson family in 1834 "For the poor children of the parish and no other---" was an all age school until the 1950's.{The grammar school {system still survives despite a long {controversy.}At present, 63 children on roll (5-11yrs.).{The Whiteparish {Educational Foundation}subsidises guitar, flute & clarinet lessons for pupils as well as other Whiteparish educational projects.{An active School {Association has more than doubled our {County allowances for Ed. purposes recently, providing much for the school. A large playing field plus many trees & shrubs give excellent out -side amenities. Senior Citizens have lunch with us Monthly. Close links - Church & other schools in area.{New {badge}- Oak/Acorn - Oaks in grounds, but also symbolic.{PLANTING OAK 1986.
